thread.title: Moaning Labour MEP says Theresa May has set Britain along a 'potentially ruinous' path
thread.title_full: Moaning Labour MEP says Theresa May has set Britain along a 'potentially ruinous' path

title: Moaning Labour MEP says Theresa May has set Britain along a 'potentially ruinous' path
text:
Moaning Labour MEP says Theresa May has set Britain along a 'potentially ruinous' path Moaning Labour MEP says Theresa May has set Britain along a 'potentially ruinous' path LABOUR MEP Seb Dance said the gap between the UK leaving the EU and agreeing a free trade deal could be "ruinous" for British business. PUBLISHED: 14:45, Wed, Jan 18, 2017 | UPDATED: 14:48, Wed, Jan 18, 2017 
Speaking to Sky News from Strasbourg, Mr Dance said Theresa May had to be more flexible in negotiating Brexit and the country was facing a “real fall”. But some bosses have said Brexit is a reason for companies to invest in Britain ahead of other EU member states. Joe Schoendorf, a partner at venture capital firm Accel, said Brexit could bolster Britain’s technology sector . SKY NEWS Seb Dance said EU trade deal gap could be "ruinous" Now that gap is of course potentially ruinous Seb Dance Despite this, Mr Dance said: “It’s all very well saying we have a long list of demands. "Of course, anyone in any negotiation will have a list of demands. But to then say that we’re not going to have any aspects of membership, we’re not going to have any half in, half out aspects of membership, but then to have a list of things that are seemingly contradictory, is setting us up for a real fall here." The MEP for London added EU negotiators wouldn't accept terms being dictated to them and give and take was what is required. He said: “Of course, we have to listen very, very carefully to what the others here are saying. Theresa May's 12 point Brexit plan Mon, January 16, 2017
